reviewText: Interesting take on a family and players that one knew for best part of almost a century.
Blake had a much more varied life than provided in the production. The 82 minutes could have been used to a greater effect.
This film by Tessa Blake is a touching documentary about her father, her family and her life.  It made me think about my relationship with my own father.  Well worth the time to watch.

Of Cource I found this book very intersting since I know 95% of the people in the book. But seriously Tess did a fine job of putting it all down on paper. Wish she had talked to me before she wrote this book I could have given her lots of interesting notes.
FM
I very much enjoyed this film.  Funny and SAD!  made me glad to be me and have my family.  At least we TALK about things!
